Definition: In this task you are given a sentence and a verb in the sentence and your task is to generate set of wh-questions starting with who, what, when, where, why, how, how much.These set of questions must contain the verb and the answers to these questions are phrases in the given sentence.The answer to these questions are associated with a specific semantic role. The questions must use pronouns instead of direct nouns that could be used to refer to various roles present in the sentence.Construct a question in such a way that (i) it is unambiguous, (ii) it is answerable from the sentence, (iii) its answer is unique (iv) its answer is a continuous text span from the paragraph (v) the length of the questions must not exceed 7. Avoid creating questions that (i) can be answered correctly without actually understanding the sentence

Positive Examples.input: Sentence: The album is named after the discredited pseudoscience of phrenology , the study of head shapes to determine intelligence and character , which was used to rationalize racism during the 19th century in the United States .Verb: named
Positive Examples.explanation: It contains the verb named which is given in the input. It is question that starts with a wh word.The answer to this question is the album and it can be found in the sentence.Also,it does not use any nouns from the sentence but uses something which is pronoun to refer to one of the roles present
